page.title: 11Shopping in Woodhalls
page.content: There are no shops in Woodhalls. People living in the area are dependent on a variety of mobile services.Milk,newspapers and bread are delivered daily; the butcher, fish - monger and greengrocer visit twice weekly.There is also a mobile hair- dresser who travels the area by car and attends all the family, men, women and children.These tradesmen not only provide the services of their trade, they also purvey local news, a very valuable service in such a scattered community. Most people pay at least a weekly visit to Okehampton or Hatherleigh for their other shopping needs.The market at Hatherleigh is a meeting place as well as a thriving shopping centre, where home-made produce, as well as livestock is bought and sold.
